chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph W Damrow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • 2nd Degree Reckless Injury, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Cts 2 & 3:   Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

No contact with drug users or sellers.
Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
Defendant to submit to random testing.
Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.
No contact with victim or victim's family unless approved by agent.
All prescriptions are to be approved by agent and doctor.
Only to use one pharmacy and sign an authorizations for agent to contact prescribing doctor and pharmacy. 
Maintain fulltime employment.
Cooperate with all mental health programs including CGIP.
Forfeiture of weapon used.

State to provide victim's requested restitution amount to defense counsel within 30 days. Amount to be determined and provided to the court 30 days after.
*11-1-16 updated restitution amount provided by Crime Victim Compensation Program

Defendant Joseph W Damrow in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:34pm Sgt. Sutherland sworn and testified. State rests. Defense rests. State moves for bind over. Defense moves to dismiss without further argument. Based on testimony court finds probable cause and binds matter over for trial. State informs. Counsel waives reading of information and enters not guilty plea to each count. Bail motion heard. State objects to any reduction of bail. Court denies any reduction of cash bail ordered. Court amends condition of bail to telephonic contact with victim. All other conditions remain in effect.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
